output: This is how, for example, the work procedure of the basket’s committee determines that the meetings’ protocols, which are closed to the public, will be published in 60 days, but in reality the protocols get published with a delay of 109–160 days, while the final meetings’ protocols sometimes don’t get published at all.

output: In cases of a birth that ended in physical injury to the newborn or the mother, examining the chain of events that led to the injury is required, as well as considering to appeal for legal counseling.

output: A lawyer specializing in the field of medical negligence will examine whether there were defects in the conduct of the medical staff during the various stages of birth that caused the damage and, as he deems appropriate, will consult a medical expert in the relevant field.

output: It must be emphasized that not every error in treatment by the medical staff amounts to negligence (in the legal sense of this term) and that various complications during childbirth do not necessarily indicate that its management was negligent.

output: When the doctor’s mistake is a consequence of lack of skill or a deviation from the reasonable level of caution, and the lack of skill and deviation from the accepted level of caution, caused damage to the patient that would not have been caused if the doctor had not operated this way.

output: In this article we will examine the different stages of childbirth, we will explain the complications that may occur in each of the stages and when they amount to medical negligence.

output: At this stage, the cervix gradually opens (to allow the passage of the fetus during birth) and at the end of the process, should reach a diameter of about ten centimeters.

output: Most of the cases of medical negligence during the labor stage deal with failure to recognize fetal distress before birth, which caused damage to the newborn, sometimes even manifesting itself as cerebral palsy.

instruction:

instruction:

output: Cerebral Palsy may be due to failure to recognize or delay in recognizing perinatal asphyxia, which is manifested as lack of oxygen supply to the brain of the fetus.

instruction:
Translate the following text from Hebrew to English:
ככלל, מעקב אחר מצבה של היולדת ופיענוח נכון של המוניטור העוקב אחר פעילות לב העובר אמורים להוביל לזיהוי מוקדם של התפתחות מצוקה עוברית, המאפשר לצוות הרפואי לפעול במהירות ולחלץ את היילוד לפני שנפגע באופן בלתי הפיך.
output: In general, monitoring the condition of the mother and correct interpretation of the monitor that follows fetal cardio activity heart should lead to early detection of fetal distress, allowing the medical team to act quickly and deliver the newborn before it is irreversibly impacted.

instruction:
Translate the following text from Hebrew to English:
מקרים שבהם מתעלם הצוות הרפואי מסימנים המעידים על כך שהעובר סובל ממחסור בחמצן או שהצוות אינו מפרש נכון את נתונים שבפניו ובפרט המוניטור העוברי או מגיב באיחור למצוקה המתבטאת במוניטור – עלולים להוות התרשלות.
output: Cases of the medical team ignoring signs indicating that the fetus is suffering from lack of oxygen or of the team not interpreting the data correctly, of the fetal monitor in particular, or reacting too late to the distress expressed on the monitor – this may constitute negligence.

output: Cerebral palsy may also be caused by prolapse of the umbilical cord, as well as by a uterine rupture that was not detected on time.

instruction:

output: Even in these difficult events, the appropriate mode of action is to find out whether the medical staff acted properly.

instruction:

output: For example, attorney Anna Raif Liganza, from the office of Caspi Seror & Co., specializings in representing victims of medical negligence, says that her office handled the claim of a child who has sustained damage during his birth after the midwife ruptured the amniotic sac when the fetus’s head was too high, thus causing the umbilical cord to prolapse (when the umbilical cord precedes the fetal head) and block the oxygen supply to the fetal brain (as a result of the pressure of the fetal head on the umbilical cord) and to be born with severe neurological damage.

instruction:

output: In another case, the lawyer said that her office filed a lawsuit due to the serious medical negligence of the staff of the maternity ward at a large hospital who, during the birth, did not recognize clear signs at the time that implied a real possibility that the mother was suffering from a ruptured uterus in the area of a surgical scar since her previous pregnancy.
